overview: This subject follows on from Applied Aural Musicianship 2. It develops versatile musical hearing, focusing on modal and chromatic language, and metrical instability.
Students determine their own pathways, concentrating on skills most relevant to their individual needs and interests.

Learning activities may include specialized keyboard lab sessions, lectures, tutorial workshops, and varied online experiences through which students will be supported in developing their overall aural abilities.

assessments.description:
4 Customised Online Tests (10% x 4)
Requiring approximately 20 hours of work in total. 800 words (equivalent)
Practical Assignment 1 - application of chosen skills to topics covered in weeks 1 to 3. 200 words (equivalent)
Practical Assignment 2 - application of chosen skills to topics covered in weeks 4 to 6. 200 words (equivalent)
Practical Assignment 3 - application of chosen skills to topics covered in weeks 7 to 9. 200 words (equivalent)
Practical Assignment 4 - application of chosen skills to topics covered in weeks 9 to 12. 200 words (equivalent)
Preparation for and participation in in‐class exercises, demonstrating skill development over time. 10 hours work required.. 200 words (equivalent)

Semester 1.Contact hours: 30 hours, comprising 18 hours on campus (one 1-hour tutorial and one 30-minute seminar per week) plus 12 hours of asynchronous online lectures

Prescribed texts: Subject guide will be posted on the LMS.
